name: Fet-Fisk
description: Nordic-Appalachian seafood restaurant, NY Times 50 Best Restaurants in America 2024, James Beard semifinalist chef Nik Forsberg, hyperseasonally changing menus with 90% farm-grown vegetables

name: Apteka
description: Vegan Eastern European restaurant, NY Times 50 Best 2022, James Beard nominations 2022-2024, 72-hour preparation processes for vegan pierogies and cultured pumpkin seed cottage cheese

name: Chengdu Gourmet
description: Authentic Sichuan cuisine from third-generation chef Wei Zhu, 2025 James Beard semifinalist, hundreds of traditional dishes focusing on mala (numbing-spicy) flavors

name: Novo Asian Food Hall
description: Asian food hall housing seven restaurants including Lolo's (Pittsburgh's first Filipino eatery), opened March 2024 in 8,600-square-foot space

name: Lolo's
description: Pittsburgh's first Filipino-focused eatery located within Novo Asian Food Hall, operates from compact 330-square-foot kitchen

name: Piyola
description: Uzbek restaurant featuring hand-pulled noodles and national dish plov, opened November 2024 as part of Pittsburgh's Uzbek restaurant trend

name: Pusadee's Garden
description: Upper Lawrenceville Thai restaurant, James Beard nomination 2024, 79-year-old matriarch uses tao charcoal cooking methods, 17-ingredient khao yum salad

name: Wise County Café
description: Appalachian-inspired comfort food evolved from 2017 pop-up, signature laminated biscuit dough technique, late 2023 brick-and-mortar opening

name: The Brinery
description: Elevated sandwich shop with house-made pickles and Pennsylvania Lobstery lobster roll, opened April 2024 after successful pop-ups

name: Stuntpig
description: Pop-up turned permanent July 2024, everything made in-house including bread, unique builds like Madonia's Muffuletta

name: Brothmonger
description: Instagram-to-storefront soup café featuring wedding soup, pastina, and vintage sofa seating, built following through Instagram DMs

name: Gi-Jin
description: Upscale sushi and gin bar requiring 13 weeks advance booking, from Richard DeShantz Restaurant Group

name: DiAnoia's Eatery
description: Modern Italian restaurant, reservations open 43 days in advance at 8am on Resy, tables fill immediately, Pittsburgh Magazine hottest ticket

name: Morcilla
description: Spanish-influenced restaurant by chef Justin Severino, Bon Appétit #4 nationally 2016, house-made charcuterie and pintxos, 40-seat intimate setting

name: Whitfield
description: Ace Hotel restaurant with chef Brent Young and James Beard nominee Bethany Zozula, refined country food celebrating Western Pennsylvania traditions

name: Main Street Diner & Kickback Cafe
description: Beetlejuice-themed restaurant with cemetery entrance, Sandworm installations, 14 movie-themed pinball machines, Polish specialties

name: Golden Gai Izakaya
description: Tokyo-inspired narrow dining with 30 seats and fish spine chandelier, channels Tokyo's narrow dining alleys

name: KuJira
description: Pittsburgh's first all-you-can-eat Japanese restaurant with three tiers ranging from $27.99 to $110 for two people

name: Wild Rosemary Bistro
description: Family-style supper club with BYOB service and ever-changing seasonal menus from chef Raymond Mikesell

name: Panadería Jazmin
description: Authentic Mexican restaurant expanded from takeout window, constant lines, family recipe tamales, churros, and café de olla

name: Alberta's Pizzeria
description: Neo-Neapolitan pizza, transitioned from 2016 food truck to July 2024 brick-and-mortar, cosmopolitan atmosphere with South African wine selection

name: Allegheny Spice Kitchen
description: Pittsburgh's only source for pressure momo (Bhutanese-Nepali dumplings), authentic Himalayan cuisine from chef Pawan Ghimirey

name: Titusz
description: Upcoming Austro-Hungarian cuisine restaurant in former Merchant Oyster Co. space with chef Csilla Thackray (formerly of Fet-Fisk)

name: Palm Palm
description: Upcoming West Coast-inspired tapas with Slim Aarons photography aesthetic

name: F&F Pizza
description: Famous NYC pizzeria's first Pittsburgh location coming to Mt. Lebanon
